metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1681 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the opj_j2k_read_SPCod_SPCoc function inj2k.c in OpenJPEG, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1681` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
